loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia de 40 años de edad es soltera y tiene un dependiente economico, la casa donde ella vive es prestada y tiene dos años cuidándola,  vive su hija y su esposo los cuales comparten los gastos con ella. Claudia es una mujer emprendora que no se detiene por nada en la vida, siempre dispuesta a salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades que se le presentan. En esta ocasión ella esta solicitando de nuestra ayuda para iniciar con su negocio de comida, comprar materia prima, además de ollas, sartenes, renta de sillas y mesas etc. Ella agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Claudia is 40 years old, single, and has one dependent. She lives in a borrowed house with her husband and child, who share the expenses with her. She’s been living there and taking care of it for two years. Claudia is a hardworking woman who doesn’t stop in life for anything. She is always trying to get ahead despite the adversities that come in her way. 
On this occasion, she is requesting our support to start a food business. She needs to purchase raw materials, in addition to pots, skillets, and pay for borrowing tables and chairs. She is grateful for the support provided to her.

loans.use: purchase raw materials, pots and skillets, and rent tables and chairs to start her food business

loans.name: Marly Elcira

texts.es:
MARLY ELCIRA tiene 35 años de edad es soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

MARLY ELCIRA  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas cada 15 días. con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas, lancha en los cultivos. el sueño es tener éxito en la vida y más ingresos. en el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
35-year old Marly Elcira is single and has three children. She lives with her children in the town of Ventanas in Los Rios province. She is a member of the July 30th Community Bank located in the neighbourhood of Zapotal Nuevo belonging to Ventanas canton. 

Marly Elcira is a farmer growing rice, beans, and corn. She is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure, and liquid weedkiller. She buys supplies and sells her produce in the town of Ventanas twice a month.

Sometimes insects eat her crops causing her problems. Her dream is to have success in life and a greater income. In her free time she likes to go to church.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure, and liquid weedkiller

loans.name: Flor Carlota

texts.es:
FLOR CARLOTA tiene 40 años edad es madre soltera, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas. 

FLOR CARLOTA  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas cada semana. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá ser mas productiva.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas, lancha en los cultivos. el sueño es tener una buena cosecha. en el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
40-year-old Flor Carlota is a single mother who lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.  She is a member of the 30 de Julio community bank which is located in Zapotal Nuevo, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in agriculture.

Flor Carlota is a farmer who grows rice, beans and corn.  She is requesting this loan to buy farm supplies, fertilizers, manure and Matamonte liquid herbicide.  She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas every week. This loan will help her to be more productive.

Flor Carlota faces challenges such as pests and crop diseases.  Her dream is to enjoy a good harvest.  She enjoys spending her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, fertilizers, manure and Matamonte liquid herbicide

loans.name: David

texts.es: Desde que era un niño David se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, comenzó al lado de su padre y sus hermanos y con el tiempo fue adquiriendo la experiencia necesaria para independizarse. Aunque David sabe producir varios tipos de cultivos es el café el que mejores resultados le ha traído pues la zona donde vive cuenta con las condiciones perfectas para un buen desarrollo de las plantas de café. Él se encarga personalmente de realizar las labores en sus fincas y lo ayudan su hija y su yerno. Para la siguiente cosecha David necesita un crédito pues tiene que comprar fertilizantes, plantas y sembrar para poder aumentar su producción. Él está muy entusiasmado con la idea de recibir un crédito por parte de KIVA el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Con las ganacias que obtenga de la cosecha a David le gustaría hacerle algunas mejoras a su casa para vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
David has been a farmer since he was a child. He started at his parent’s and siblings’ side and over time acquired the experience necessary to work independently. Although he knows how to produce various kinds of crops, coffee is the crop that has yielded the best results, since the area where he lives has perfect conditions for good coffee production.

David does the work on his farm himself, helped by his daughter and son-in-law. He needs a loan for his next harvest because he needs to buy fertilizer, coffee plants and to plant them so that he can expand his production. He is excited at the idea of receiving  a loan from KIVA, which he will pay back at the end of the harvest. With the profits he obtains from the harvest, David would like to make some improvements on his house so he can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Quilmana con su esposa y su pequeño de hijo de 4 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos Manuel tuvo que separarse de su familia para laborar en otra ciudad, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Manuel trabaja como operario en un taller de mecánica, adicionalmente los fines de semana cuando retorna a su ciudad trabaja como obrero en un pequeño terreno de cultivo de papa, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño, dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Manuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina pequeña, un refrigerador, así como una pequeña mesa y sillas; de esta manera Manuel contará con los utensilios necesarios para que poco a poco con ayuda de su esposa pueda iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y en un futuro no muy  lejano desea cumplir su gran sueño de tener su restaurante y ver convertido a su pequeño hijo en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old and lives in the town of Cañete in Quilmana district with his wife and 4-year old son. He loves them very much and they are the centre of his life. Manuel is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, makes a great deal of effort to get ahead. Unfortunately because he needs to work and to pay their expenses, Manuel had to leave his family and go to work in another town. In his free time he loves to spend time with his family.

With much determination and enthusiasm Manuel works as an operator in an auto repair shop. In addition, when he returns to his home town at weekends, he works on the land growing potatoes. Every day early in the morning he starts work and finishes approximately twelve hours later. He believes that all is going well thanks to his hard work, dedication, and friendly treatment of other people.

Manuel is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy a small stove, a refrigerator, a small table and chairs. In this way he will have the items necessary for his wife to start a small business selling food. Then in the not-too-distant future he hopes to achieve his dream of owning a restaurant. He also wishes to see his young son get a good job and earn lots of money.

loans.use: buy a small stove, a refrigerator, table and chairs

loans.name: Corina Fernanda

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por superarse y sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, ahora ella es padre y madre para su hijo, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Corina se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Corina trabaja en un restaurant de comida rápida de su ciudad, brindando atención al público, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 6 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño, dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Corina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho en sus estudios, así como para realizar sus trabajos; de esta manera Corina contará con la herramienta necesaria para cursar satisfactoriamente sus estudios, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a su familia pueda salir adelante y convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Corina is a 20-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica together with her parents and her young son.  She is a very kind, keen, hard-working person who puts a lot of effort into doing well and providing for her family.   Unfortunately, for a number of reasons, she is separated from her partner and is now both mother and father to her son.  Thanks to her own efforts and the support of her family, Corina is studying for a law degree.  In her free time she enjoys reading and sometimes cooks a delicious meal of duck and rice to share with her family.

Corina puts a lot of effort and enthusiasm into her work serving customers at a fast food restaurant in her city.  She works every day and has a very early start.  She works approximately six hours a day and believes that she is doing well because she performs her duties well and with dedication, and treats others in a friendly manner.

Corina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a computer.  This will be very useful for her studies as she will be able to do her assignments on it.  She will have the piece of equipment she needs to study successfully.  This will allow her to continue working hard so that she and her family can make progress in life and she can become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase desks and books and pay the school's bills.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha es una joven de 25 años, vive en  la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo de 1 año, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja, ahora ella es padre y madre para su pequeño, ella es una mujer luchadora, entusiasta y muy perseverante, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos a trabajar para salir adelante; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto con su pequeño, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de Contabilidad que tanto quería, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su hermana, Martha  puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, Martha cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos productos que vende, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda sus clientes.  
Martha se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina, así como mercadería, tales como perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros; de esta manera Marhta tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado, con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario para ampliar su negocio y así asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Martha is a 25 year old woman.  She lives with her little one year old son in the city of Ica in the Parcona district.  Sadly, for various reasons, she separated from her life partner.  Now she is father and mother to her little one.  

She is a tenacious, enthusiastic, and very perseverant woman.  She devotes all of her efforts to working in order to get ahead.  In her free time she likes to watch television with her little one.  Sadly, for lack of financial resources, she was not able to study for the accounting degree that she so wanted to be able to do.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Tallarines Verdes’ [green pesto noodles] to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and thanks to her sister’s support, Martha started up her own business of selling beauty products.  She devotes approximately eight hours a day to her business.  During that time she is able to tend to a good number of customers.  Martha believes that her business is going well due to the good products that she sells and the kind and respectful manner in which she treats her customers.

Martha is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her, she will be able to buy a display case and merchandise like perfume and cosmetics, among others.  This way Martha will have a business that is better stocked and better equipped.  With this she hopes to be able to increase her sales and income.  This way she hopes to gradually save the money needed to expand her business and assure her little son’s well-being and future.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise like perfume and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 40-year-old married man. He has two children age 5 and 10 years. He describes himself as creative. 

He operates a service business where he provides electronic installation services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of electrical goods. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy electrical goods. His business goal is to run a electrical retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business and his family's living standard. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: Détaillant de produits d’alimentation générale à la maison, Marcelle est une femme mariée à un magasinier de 41 ans. Elle à 03 enfants tous scolarisés et sont âgés de 18, 15 et 08ans. Elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de notre institution pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et du charbon de bois. Elle désire réinvestir  les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité et espère ouvrir son  propre super marché plus tard. Comme perspective d’avenir, elle veut construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marcelle sells general food products from her home. She is married to a 41-year-old storekeeper, and the couple have three children ages 8, 15 and 18 who all go to school. 

Marcelle is seeking a second loan from WAGES to stock up on general food products and charcoal. She plans to reinvest her profits in her activity, and someday open her own grocery store. Her goal for the future is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Luciano Wladimir

texts.es:
LUCIANO WLADIMIR tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

LUCIANO WLADIMIR  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, ranger, insecticidas, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas cada semana. con la ayuda del crédito cambiaria en una forma positiva porque con el credito tendrá más ingresos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas que se presenta en el periodo de la siembra. El sueño es tener una vida productiva para así tener un negocio fiable y productivo. En el tiempo libre le gusta los juegos, y disfrutar de las fiestas que hay en el cantón.
texts.en:
Luciano Wladimir is 21 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province. He is a member of the 30 de Julio Communal Bank, which is located in Zapotal Nuevo precinct, part of Ventanas canton. All of the members are farmers.

Luciano Wladimir farms rice, beans and corn. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, Ranger herbicide, insecticides and liquid Matamonte herbicide. He will make his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas every week. With help from the loan he would make a positive change because he will have higher earnings with the loan.

He confronts challenges such as pests, which infest his crops during the planting season. His dream is to have a productive life so that he can own a reliable and productive business. In his spare time he enjoys games and the festivals held in the canton,

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost, Ranger herbicide, insecticides and liquid Matamonte herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy molds for making water pipes and wells.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is involved in agriculture. He raises cows and chickens, keeps beehives, cultivates onions and grows fruit trees. Karen would like to develop beekeeping, which requires sufficient investments. With the requested loan, Karen plans to purchase 13 beehives. Karen will also purchase forage to feed the cows.
 
Karen hopes to earn more income from the sales of honey, which will give him the opportunity to keep expanding his farm. 

Karen lives in Yeghegnadzor town with his wife, father and brother. Agricultural income is vital for the family to cover daily costs and make ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for colonies of bees and forage for cows.

loans.name: José Wilfredo

texts.es:
Don José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, emprendedora muy dedicada a su familia y a la prosperidad de ellos. Es agricultor desde su niñez, disfruta de lo que hace, tiene mucha experiencia produciendo 30 sacos de maíz por 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo siendo su limitante los recursos económicos para ampliar su producción.

Compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad que esta muy lejos de donde él reside, para desplazarse le es difícil ya que donde vive carece de transporte; lo más común es trasladarse a caballo, siendo esa la razón por la cual se le dificulta trasladar los insumos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar siete sacos de fertilizantes, dos galones de herbicidas, semillas de fríjol para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de fríjol. Con la inversión, manifiesta don José que comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez y pagara un vehiculo para trasladarlos evitando perder tiempo y dinero. Al mismo tiempo, garantizara que sus cultivos tengan los fertilizantes en el momento oportuno; a fin de obtener una mejor producción e ingresos con los que espera proporcionar a su familia lo mas necesario como lo es la salud y la educación de sus hijos. 

Don José espera, que el crédito sea una alternativa para realizar cosas, que con sus propios recursos se le dificulta como la educación de sus hijos, mejorar la vivienda. Quiere darse a conocer en la Institución
texts.en:
José is 31 years of age, married, and has two children. He is known to be a hard-working person, who has an entrepreneurial spirit and is highly dedicated to his family and their prosperity. He has worked as a farmer since his childhood, and enjoys what he does. He has a lot of experience, and harvests 30 sacks of beans per 7,000 square meters sown. His only limitation is the financial resources he lacks to expand his crop harvest.

José buys his agricultural supplies in a city which is very far from where he lives. It’s difficult to travel there as there is no transportation where José lives. The most usual way is to go by horse, and this is why it is so difficult to transport the supplies.

The loan José has requested from Fundación Campo will be used to buy seven sacks of fertilizers, two gallons of herbicide, and bean seeds to sow 7,000 square meters of beans. José says he will use this investment to buy all the supplies at once, and will also pay for a vehicle to transport them, thereby saving time and money. Likewise, he will ensure that his crops have the fertilizers at the right time, so that he can have a larger harvest and greater income, which he hopes will give his family what they need in terms of health and the education of his children.

José hopes that this loan will offer an alternative to allow him to do things that aren’t easy for him due to his limited resources, such as educating his children and making improvements to his home. He would like to become well known within the institution.

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of fertilizers, two gallons of herbicide, and bean seeds to sow 7,000 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambat is a 52-year-old farmer from a rural area of Kror Kor district, Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is married and has five children, two of whom are still dependent on him. 

He has been making his living through rice farming on his one-hectare farmland for 30 years. To add more income to his family, he is also making palm sugar. With the business that he has been doing, he is able to earn approximately 23,000 KHR per day and able to save around 13,000 KHR per day.

Sambat is a second-cycle loan client with VisionFund. The first loan enabled him to save some portion of his income for covering his expenses in the family. Sambat and his other group member, who is the third-cycle loan client with VisionFund, are requesting a new loan with VisionFund. He will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers. He expects to double his income and keep up a good lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and increase his crop yields.

loans.name: Re's Group

texts.en:
Re is a 41-years-old married mother of five children, four of whom are under her care and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. 

Rice farming and pigs raising, which she has been in for twelve years to support the family, are the main sources of the family’s income. To help the family generate income, her husband also works as a paid worker in a local area. She and her husband are able to earn approximately 23,000 KHR per day to support the family's needs.

Re has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans. (The other member is just with VisionFund this cycle.) The past loans have supported her business well. Now she is leading the group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feeds. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business to gain more income so as to improve her family’s standard of  living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Ruth  Kamene

texts.en: Ruth is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She operates a butcher shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years. Previously, she used to operate a grocery store. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi runs an agro vet business in Olkalau town and has been in business for the past 10 years. He is 39 years old, married to Rebecca, and they have two children. 

This is his third loan; he plans to buy animal feed to meet his customers' demands. Lawi hopes to grow his business and make more income, hence improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 38 years old and married to Elijah. They are blessed with three children, ages 14, seven, and two. She has been in business for five years and earns KES 30,000. 

She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy more animals to sell. The profit she makes will be used to expand her business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi a pour activité principale la revente de produits d’alimentation générale qu’elle pratique à la maison. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés dont le premier est âgé de 11 ans et le dernier a 5 ans. Épouse de cuisinier, et âgée de 41 ans, elle sollicite son troisième crédit auprès de notre institution pour l’achat de produits d’alimentation générale afin de renforcer son commerce. Elle désire assurer la réussite de ses enfants en investissant les bénéfices de ses activités dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Afi’s main business activity is the sale of general food products from her home. She is 41 years old and married to a cook. The couple have three children aged 5 to 11 who all go to school. 

Afi is seeking a third loan from WAGES to strengthen her business by stocking up on general food products. She wants to ensure her children’s success by investing her profits in their education.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, age 45, lives in a rural area of Krolanh district located in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is married and also a mother of two children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. 

To make a living, she farms rice on her one-hectare farmland and also sells grilled chicken. She has been involving in this business for seven years. Every day she earns approximately 19,000 KHR and manages to save around 10,000 KHR. 

Sokha and her group member, who both are first-time borrowers with VisionFund, are now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. With her loan portion, she will buy more chickens to grill. She hopes to increase her income in order to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to grill.

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi / Gkn Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure  fait partie du groupe Dukundubuhinzi /Gkn. Le nom du groupe signifie «Aimer l’agriculture».Il a 26 ans et il est marié. Il a 1 personne dans sa charge. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Bonaventure est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre se activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le grand producteur connu dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire sa propre belle maison.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is a member of the group Dukundubuhinzi /Gkn whose name means “loving agriculture”. He is a 26-year-old married man with one dependent. He attended six years of secondary school.

Bonaventure is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor. 

His business growth strategy is to apply for additional loans to help expand his activity. In the years to come, he would like to become the leading rice farmer in the region. He plans to use his profits to build his own beautiful house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Thouy's Group

texts.en:
Thouy is a 52-year-old married mother of four children and earns a living through farming rice on a two-hectare area of farmland. Having been involved in this business for 33 years, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy business. 

Thouy’s group consists of five members who live in the same village of the Pursat province of Bakan district, Cambodia. She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. The first loan has relieved her family’s financial burden. Now she and her group members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. Thouy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to earn a larger income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang lives in a rural village of the Battambang province's Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. He is 47 years old and has six children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. For twenty-five years he has earned a living by catching fish to sell. Sometimes he and his wife work for others for a fee to better support their daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his fish business. 

Leang has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for five loans. He fully repaid the past loans which have relieved his family's financial burden and bought some fishing nets. Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund for $750. Leang will use his loan to buy new fishing nets and a boat for supporting his current business, and to fix his old boat. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase her business to gain extra income so as to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a boat for his business

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh is a 32-year-old villager who lives in the rural area of Sangke district, located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been making her living through rice farming for three years. This rice-farming business has enabled her to earn approximately 28,000 Riel (KHR) per day.

Nhanh's group consists of three female members who are on their sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The previous loans made her living conditions better and supported her children's education. Nhanh is now leading a group of three to request a new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will spend her portion of the loan on plowing her rice farm and transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes to grow her cash-crop in a timely way so she can move her family ahead.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee and transplanting her rice seedling

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a school, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her school is located within a good environment and her primary customers are student below the age of 11.  Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds for improving her school. 

Teresia is requesting her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy stationery. Her goal is to expand her school within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her school by getting more students.

loans.use: to purchase stationery.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng, 52, lives in a village of the Pouk district of Siem Reap province and has nine children, one of whom is under her care and is a student. 

Rice growing is the main source of family income, and she has been involved in this business for 30 years. From the current business, she is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day after compensating daily expenses. The scarcity of water supply for supporting the rice business is the main challenge for Eng.

Her group consists of two members who live in the same village. Eng is in her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group member of two to request for a loan with VisionFund of 800,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy piglets for raising to generate extra income. With this loan, Eng expects to enlarge her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and piglets for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Shaig

texts.en:
Shaig lives in the Baku region with his family. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli town. He is married and has one child. He is 35 years old. 

Shaig has been in his taxi business for six years. He needs 2000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to repair his car. Shaig loves his work and wants to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik lives in Malishka village, Vayots Dzor region, with his wife and daughter. 

Martik runs a farm where he is raising a calf and hens and growing fruit trees. Martik started cattle raising two years ago, and now he plans to purchase one more calf. Martik will also use this loan for purchasing forage to feed the calves and hens. 

Agriculture is the main source of income for Martik's family, and its development means improvement of living conditions and better life quality for them.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is 25 years old and originally from a rural area of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with one daughter, who is still dependent on her. 

To feed her family, Sokha plants rice, cabbages, and chilies. Through this planting, she earns about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Sina with VisionFund, one of the partners of Kiva. The previous loan has enabled her to better support her business. 

In her group, consisting of two female members, she is the group leader. Each of them is seeking a loan of 1,300,000 KHR. With her portion of loan, Sina is going to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and, most important, to be able to send her only child to school.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Monicah  Nyambura

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are in school. She operates a grocery store in a competitive environment to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for two years and has employed one person. Besides this business, she rears pigs to generate more income. 

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of owning rental houses in the future. Monicah is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Inkomezamihigo / Mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Eliezer  fait partie du groupe Inkomezamihigo / Mgnz. Le nom du groupe signifie «Le performance des membres».Il a 64 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 8 ans  à 30 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autres que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Eliezer est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Eliezer is part of the Inkomezamihigo/Mgnz group, the name of which means “member performance”. He is 64 years of age, married, and has eight children aged between 8 and 30 years of age, two of whom are at school. In addition to his children he has a further two people under his care. Eliezer himself studied six years of elementary school.

Eliezer works growing rice, and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor expenses associated with his business. To expand his rice-growing business, he plans to request other loans to expand his rice capacity. Over the coming years, Eliezer would like to become the best rice grower in the region. He plans to use the profits he makes to cover his children’s education and health needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the labor expenses associated with his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Nyta's Group

texts.en:
Nyta is 27 years old and lives in the rural area of Sangke district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She is the mother of one daughter. To make a living, she has been in farming rice for eight years and supplements her income by planting cucumbers and selling cakes, while her husband works as a paid worker.

Nyta has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loans which have supported her current business, and now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she would like to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. 

She expects to grow her rice healthfully so as to increase family’s income and expand her field business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en: Sokhoeurn, age 37, is a villager who lives in a rural area of Sangke District, located in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a married mother with four children, two daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her. Sokhoeurn is a farmer who has been planting corn for 10 years. Her farming business enables her to earn around 27,000 KHR per day and save less than 9,000 KHR. Sokhoeurn has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has completely paid back the first loan. The first loan that she requested helped her better her family’s living conditions. Due to low corn yields, she is now leading a group of two to take out a new loan with VisionFund. She is going to spend her loan portion on plowing her corn field and buying corn seeds. She will dedicate all of her efforts to moving her family ahead and enrolling all of her children in a good school through this loan.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and for corn seed

loans.name: Millian

texts.en:
Millian is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in Ndunyu Njeru.  Millian is a farmer, which she has been doing  for four years. 

Millian is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings.  She hopes to see her farm expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ann  Njoki

texts.en:
Ann is 35 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. To earn a living, she sells charcoal, which she has been doing for four years. Prior to selling charcoal, she sold clothes. 

Ann is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy charcoal to sell. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Yanek

texts.en:
Yanek lives in Vayk town in the Vayots Dzor region. For the last ten years he has been involved in beekeeping and keeps 19 beehives at present. Yanek would like to add more beehives, which will allow him to make more honey and earn additional income from its sales. 
Yanek lives with his wife and mother. Additional income is important to him to purchase more beehives and continue the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
A villager of the Kandal province’s Kandal Steng district, Ren is 45 years old and married with two children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are dependent on her. Ren is a seven-year experienced tailor who earns approximately 6.00 USD per day while her husband is a rice farmer.

Ren is a first cycle client with VisionFund. She requests a loan of 600 USD to buy necessary materials for building a house, including wooden boards, nails, cement, sand, etc.. She hopes to have a decent house for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for building her house

loans.name: Carmen Sofia

texts.es:
CARMEN SOFIA tiene 54 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

CARMEN SOFIA  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, ranger, insecticidas.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas cada 15 días. con la ayuda del crédito podrá superar el negocio.

enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos. el sueño es tener éxito en la vida. en el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Carmen Sofia is 54 years old and has a common law marriage. She lives with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province. She is a member of the 30 de Julio Communal Bank, which is located in Zapotal Nuevo precinct, belonging to Ventanas canton. All of the members are farmers.

Carmen Sofia farms rice, beans and corn and is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, Ranger herbicide and insecticides. She will make her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas every 15 days. With the help of this loan, her business will be able to succeed.

She confronts challenges such as pest infestations in her crops. Her dream is to succeed in life. In her spare time she enjoys going to church.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, Ranger herbicide and insecticides.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 32 years old and single. He has been operating his retail shop for the past six years. He lives in Nakuru, and his business has been very profitable.

Ben has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to stock more rice and maize flour for his shop. This will be his second loan, after successfully paying the previous one.

In the future, Ben hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale business to earn more income.

loans.use: to stock more rice and maize flour

loans.name: Mereu

texts.en:
Mereu is 28 years old and married to Motoora. She is blessed with two children aged twelve and two years. She has been in business for one year and  she earns 6,000 KES.
This is her first KADET business loan, which she will use to purchase more farm products. The profit she makes will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to have a profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more farm products.

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en: Fadhila has witnessed great growth in her business. She repaid her loan on time. Fadhila was also able to revive her retail shop that had ceased trading. She is now asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase additional retail stock for her business, e.g. flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap. She also intends to purchase tree seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock and more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat is a 34-year-old mother of three sons living in Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. Sarat has been farming for almost 15 years as a main source of income. To add more income, she also tailors clothes. The current business earns her about 5 USD per day.

Sarat is a second-cycle client with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The first loan helped her to better support her family’s living condition and pursue her children’s education. Now she leads a group of four members to seek a new loan; all of them are seeking the same amount, 500,000 KHR each. For Sarat, the loan portion will be used to buy fertilizers to use in her rice field and she hopes that this loan will provide her with higher crop yields so that she can better support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Margaret  Wanjiku

texts.en: Margaret is 39 years old and married with two children who are in school. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for 10 years and has employed one person. Besides that, she runs a motorcycle transport business to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, her business has improved because she has been trained on business management skills. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has previously taken a loan from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, which helped him to buy beans, maize, and green peas for his cereal business. This helped his business to improve and he invested the additional income. He has started building rental houses and now hopes to complete them. He has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to complete his rental houses.

loans.use: to complete his rental houses.

loans.name: Argishti

texts.en:
Argishti is involved in agriculture. He raises cows and pigs and cultivates watermelon. Argishti also works as a trainer in a local kickboxing federation.
Argishti has been involved in agriculture for more than ten years to have more income to sustain his family. Now he would like to develop his farm. With the help of this loan he plans to purchase two pigs and grass and forage to feed the livestock. 
Argishti lives with his wife and sister. His wife works at the local school as a teacher, and also runs the household. Additional income from agriculture will help the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for grass, forage, and two pigs.

loans.name: N'zinga

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes, de produits cosmétiques, et divers, Nzinga est une jeune femme mariée à un enseignant et mère d’un enfant de 05 ans. Ce dernier est scolarisé. Âgée de 37 ans, elle assure la distribution de ses produits depuis 2007. Elle sollicite son premier prêt à WAGES  pour s’approvisionner en stock de produits cosmétiques et de pagnes. Elle désire épargner les profits supplémentaires pour ouvrir une boutique et assurer la stabilité financière de sa famille.
texts.en:
N'zinga is a young woman of 37 and a retailer of "pagnes" (traditional West African cloth), cosmetics and sundries. She is married to a teacher and is the mother of a five-year-old child who attends school.

N'zinga has been selling her goods since 2007. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to stock her inventory of cosmetics and "pagnes". N'zinga's goal is to save her additional income so that she can open her own shop and ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" (traditional West African cloth), cosmetics and sundries for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen lives in Kechut village with his wife, Anahit, his 2 daughters, and son. Armen works at the local fire service, but his salary is too low to sustain the family. So Armen also runs a farm, where he raises cows and grows apples, pears, and walnut trees. Armen would like to purchase one more cow, which will allow him to gather and sell more milk and earn more income. Armen is the only breadwinner for his family, and development of his agricultural business is vital for him to provide a stable income for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 to 15 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Joyce will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more curtains. Her business goal is to run a fully-stocked business with curtains within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent business location. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy curtains for resale

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, a pesar de ser joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre de su pequeño; en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia, Liliana no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía que tanto quería, pero desea poder hacerlo muy pronto. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Liliana  puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, Liliana cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos productos que vende, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda sus clientes.  
Liliana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos mostradores y mercadería, tales como perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros; de esta manera Liliana tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, acondicionado y podrá exhibir mejor sus productos, con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario para ampliar su negocio y contar con un local propio para realizar sus ventas, y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y ver a su pequeño hijo convertido en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 20, lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and her little son.  In spite of being young, she is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Sadly, for various reasons, she separated from her life partner.  Ever since then she has been father and mother to her little one.  In her free time she likes to play sports.  Sometimes she makes the delicious duck with rice to share with her family.  Liliana was not able to study for a career in gastronomy as she so wanted to do.  However, she hopes to be able to do so very soon.

On her own initiative, and with support from her mother, Liliana started her small business of selling beauty products.  She devotes approximately 12 hours a day to her business.  During that time she is able to tend to a good number of customers.  Liliana believes that her business is going well because of the good products that she sells and the kind and respectful way that she treats her customers.

Liliana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her she will be able to buy two display cases and merchandise like perfume and cosmetics, among others.  This way Liliana will have a better stocked and better equipped business.  She will be able to better display her products.  This way she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her income.  By doing so she hopes to be able to, little by little, save the money needed to expand her business and have her own place to make her sales.  

In the not so distant future she wishes to fulfill her big dream of having her own house.  She also dreams of seeing her young son become a professional and an honorable man.

loans.use: to buy two display cases and merchandise like perfume and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean, aged 40, lives in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is married with three children – one daughter and two sons – all of whom are dependent on him. He supports his family through rice cropping as the primary source of income and supplements his income by working for others for a fee. His wife also helps to earn more income by tailoring clothes.

Hean is leading a group of four, all of whom are third-loan-cycle clients with Kiva partner VisionFund. They are requesting a new loan. The past few loans have provided Hean with a higher income to use to meet his family’s needs, better his family’s living environment, and also make his children healthier. With his portion of this loan, Hean will buy fertilizers to use in his rice-farming business and use the other portion to pay for plowing. Through his loan portion, he hopes to strengthen his rice-farming business so as to increase his income to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Houn lives in the rural area of the Kandal province’s Kandal stoeng district of Cambodia. She is 37 years old, married and has one daughter who works at a clothing factory. 

Rice farming has been the main source of income for the family for several years, and Houn supplements the income by selling cakes in her local area. She is able to earn approximately US$4 per day and manages to save about US$2.5 every day after daily expenses. 

Houn's group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is the first loan for her group with VisionFund. She and her group members are requesting a loan of KHR 160,000 from VisionFund. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials to build a proper latrine, such as toilet bowls, tile drainage etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old. She is a single mother of two children aged ten and seven years old. She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for the past five years, earning a good income.
This is her second loan from Kiva partner KADET. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of rice, cooking fat and sugar for her shop. She paid back her previous loan well.
Ruth hopes to excel in business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Kror Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Kror Nhanh is a 39-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her family’s needs, she and her husband have been involving in farming rice, raising pigs, planting beans and making hashed fish meat and sometimes working for others for a fee, and have been in this type of business for several years. From the current business, Kror Nhanh is able to earn about 45,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 13,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is a big challenge for her paddy business. 

Kror Nhanh has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three loans while the other members have been with VisionFund from two to six loan cycles. She has used her past loans to better support her family in providing sufficient food. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a new loan. Kror Nhanh, who is the group leader, will use one portion of her loan to plow the land for bean planting and the other portion on labor for harvesting rice. She expects this loan will help her business improve progressively, improve her living standards and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plow land for bean planting and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Hervé

texts.fr: Hervé est un homme âgé de 40 ans, célibataire et père d' un enfantâgé de 04 ans.Il est scolarisé.Il a ouvert et gère un cyber café dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 01 an.Son bon emplacement,sa sociabilité et son dynamisme lui ont permis d'acquerir une clientèle considérable qu'elle a du mal à satisfaire à cause de son manque du petit matériel.Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter(une photocopieuse et une imprimante couleur)afin de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle et augmenter ses ventes.Les bénéfices issus de ce crédit lui permettront de reinvestir dans, la divretifier et s'occuper de son enfant.
texts.en:
Hervé, age 40, is a single father of a 4-year-old child who goes to school. He runs a cybercafé, which he opened in a district of the capital a year ago. A great location, combined with his good nature and enthusiasm have helped him to build a substantial customer base whose needs he can hardly meet due to a shortage of equipment. 

Hervé is seeking a loan to buy a copier and a color printer to help meet the needs of his many customers and to bolster his sales. 

He will use the profits earned through this loan to reinvest in his business and diversify his services, and to take care of his child.

loans.use: to buy a copier and a color printer.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 43,  is a married mother of five children, two dependent on her. Her family lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province. To feed the family, she has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years and selling grocery items such as eggs, salt and sugar in the local area. The current business earns her approximately KHR 30,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after expenses. 

Sokha’s group consists of four members who live in the same village.This is the first loan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the group leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use some some of the loan to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes to gain more income from the rice paddy so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and more grocery items for selling.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 60 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with grown up children.

James is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizer and seedlings to use on his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do better after the loan.

He hopes to become the top farmer in his area and its environs.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en: Lak is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in the rural area of Krolanh District located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Lak is a farmer who farms on her two-hectare rice field. To better feed her family, she raises seven pigs. She has been farming for 10 years, enabling her to earn approximately 28,000 KHR each day. Lak is leading a group consisting of two members, both first-cycle loan clients with VisionFund, The group is taking out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Lak will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed. Through this loan portion, Lak hopes to increase her rice crop yields and fatten her pigs so as to generate more income for her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig's feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Lemeiloi  Ole

texts.en: Lemeiloi is 38 years old and married with two children. He raises and sells livestock to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years and employs one person. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to keep his business records because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of owning a slaughterhouse in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 38 years old. She is married to John and together they have one child, aged four years. She operates a grocery store and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd., after she was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer. She will use the loan to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits for resale in her business.

She hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, les presento a un joven entusiasta, luchador y con futuro prometedor, así se caracteriza Anthony de 20 años de edad, quien estudia soporte técnico de computadoras, Anthony tiene una pasión muy en particular por las computadoras y es por eso que decidió estudiar esta profesión, Anthony estudia todos días  dedicando mas de 4 horas  alos estudios, posterior a eso trabaja ayudándole a su padre en un taller de refacciones mecánicas el cual le brida ganancias para poder solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios. Anthony en el futuro le gustaría culminar sus estudios y poder desempeñarse como programador de computadoras para diversas empresas. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de sus mensualidades de estudio. Anthony se encuentra muy contento por el préstamo otorgado y agradece la enorme confianza que le brindaron al otorgarle este préstamo que le ayudara mucho ha cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú. 

Meet an enthusiastic young man, a fighter with a promising future. That is how Anthony, 20 years old, is characterized. He is studying computer technical support. He is very passionate about computers and therefore decided to study the profession.

Anthony dedicates more than four hours to his studies every day.  After his studies, he helps his father in his workshop, doing repairs as a mechanic, a job that provides enough income to pay for some of his educational costs.

In the future, Anthony would like to finish his studies and work as a computer programmer for different businesses. He will use this loan to pay the monthly expenses for his studies. He is pleased about the loan, which will help him to meet his goals, and is grateful for the great confidence shown in him.

loans.use: to pay for monthly educational expenses.

loans.name: Malat's Group

texts.en: A resident from Sangke District of Battambang Province, Cambodia, Malat is a married mother of three children. All of her three children--two daughters and one son--are still dependent on her. To provide for the daily basic needs of her family, she has been farming for four years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. The lack of water is a big challenge for her farmland. Malat has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for four cycles. The previous loans have enabled her to improve her family’s living conditions. Malat is now leading a group of two to request a new loan with VisionFund. She is applying for 1,400,000 KHR, while her fellow group member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. With her portion of the loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and save a portion to cover her plowing costs. She hopes to make more income for a better quailty of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed and pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old and married with two children between 8 and 16 years old.  He is from Ndunyu Njeru, Kenya.

Samuel has a retail shop that he has been running for the past 32 years.  He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to expand his shop in the near future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goods to resell in his store.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 34 years old and married, with four children ranging in age from 3 years to 15 years. She sells dried oyster, fish and corn at Moriba town in the southern area of Bo in Sierra Leone. She wakes up early in the morning and goes to the next village to her local food market. 

She's been in this business for 7 years. She does not have any other source of income aside from her business. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy dried oyster, fish and corn. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and improve her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy dried oyster, fish and corn.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet  lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a motorcycle for transport, a business she has been operating for one year now. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. 

Janet is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to repair her motorcycle and to set up a grocery stall. The extra income will saved toward the purchase of other motorcycles in future.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle and to set up a grocery stall.

loans.name: Jenny Andrea

texts.es:
Jenny aprendió la actividad de la agricultura gracias a su padre quien siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad y con esto ha podido generar ingresos para su familia y tener una buena calidad de vida en su hogar. Junto con su esposo, quien también aprendió de su padre, tienen un cultivo de verduras y una crianza de pollos, y así generan los ingresos para la familia que está compuesta por sus 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que padecen, el esfuerzo que hace le ha permitido sacar adelante este negocio y ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos un buen crecimiento; sin embargo, a pesar de sus esfuerzos, el clima ha hecho que sus cultivos se dañen y así pierda dinero. Por esto para recuperarse Jenny busca un préstamo que le permita comprar abonos y riegos para el cultivo y comprar más pollos y el cuido para su crianza.

Su sueño es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio con el que pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Jenny learned to farm thanks to her father who was always dedicated to this activity, and with this skill, she has been able to generate income for her family and maintain a good quality of life in her home. Together with her husband, who also learned from his father, they have a vegetable farm and they raise chickens. This is how they generate income for their family, composed of their 2 children, aged 3 and 8.

Despite economic difficulties, Jenny's efforts have permitted her to advance this business and offer their 2 children a good childhood. Nevertheless, despite their efforts, the climate has caused damage to their crops and led to the loss of money. That is why Jenny is seeking a loan that will permit her to buy fertilizers and pay for crop irrigation, and to buy more chickens and care for them as they grow.


Jenny's dream is to be able to develop a large business that will allow her to offer her children a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to progress.

loans.use: pay for fertilizers and irrigation for her crops and to buy chickens and pay for the care required to raise them.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, vive con su hija y el esposo de su hija, tiene dos nietos, Cristina está casada, se dedica a la venta de verduras, conejos,  gallinas, también realiza la siembra de maíz, estos oficios tiene alrededor de 9 y 10 años de realizarlos, también las verduras las vende todos los días por las mañanas y tardes, todo lo hace con su familia, quienes le apoyan para realizar los negocios.

Ésta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la siembra y comprarse abono y herbicidas, otra parte de este préstamos no invertirá en la compra de comida para los animales como lo es concentrado y lechugas, también invertirá otra parte en el pago de mozos que le ayuda para hacer el proceso de la siembra, este préstamo le dará el fortalecimiento para que continúe realizando su trabajo, realice una buena compra, ella se esmera por salir adelante junto con su familia, entre los riesgos que puede tener en la siembra son los cambios climáticos que afecta directamente la producción.
Entre sus aspiraciones a crecer en el comercio, poder proveer a su familia lo necesario, crecer en la granja y aumentar la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Cristina is married and lives with her daughter and son-in-law, who have two children. Cristina sells vegetables, rabbits and chickens, and she also sows corn. She’s been doing these activities for about 9 or 10 years. She sells vegetables every day in the mornings and afternoons; she does everything with her family, who support her, so she can run her businesses. 

She’s requesting a loan for planting -- with one part of the loan she’ll buy manure and herbicides, with another, she’ll invest in food for her animals, like lettuce and concentrated animal food, and another part of the loan she’ll use to pay the hired hands that help her plant the crop. This loan will give her the support she needs to continue her work and help her make good purchases. She works hard to get ahead with her family. Some of the challenges she faces with her crop are the possible weather changes that directly affect production.

She aspires to grow her business, provide for her family, expand her animal farm and increase production of her crops.

loans.use: buy manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 37 years old.  He is married to Rebbecca and they have two children together.  He is a milk vendor and has been in this business for the past 11 years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He paid back his previous loan well and in good time.  He will use this loan to purchase more milk to sell in his business.  He hopes to open a milk bar in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Duterimberemubuhinzi /nykby Group

texts.fr:
Maurice  fait partie du groupe Duterirmberemubuhinzi. Le nom du groupe signifie «developper l’agriculture».Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 ans  à 3 ans. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Maurice est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mauritius is part of the group "Duterirmberemubuhinzi." The group's name means "developing agriculture." Mauritius is 28 years old and is married with two children. In addition to his children (aged one and three years old), Mauritius has one additional dependent. He has had six years of primary education.

Mauritius is rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to to pay his workers and to purchase fertilizer for his rice farming. To increase the yields from his farming, he plans to seek additional loans in order to boost his capacity for rice production. In the coming years, he would like to be the best rice producer in the region. With the income he earns, Mauritius plans to pay for the school fees and medical care of his children.

loans.use: to pay his workers and to purchase fertilizer for his rice farming.

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal AGUA BUENA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Isabel, la socia tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta como platanos,manzanas,papayas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia cría  a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que más le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de fruta al por mayor como naranjas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de pasto, compra y venta de queso, crianza de animales, imprenta, tienda de abarrotes.

Las socias que salen en la foto con la cara oculta son socias que no pertenecen al banco comunal y los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Isabel, 33, is a member of the “Agua Buena” (Good Water) communal bank located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and three children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling fruit like bananas, apples and papayas, among others.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  

In addition, she raises small farm animals like guinea pigs.  She raises them in order to sell them to customers that request them.  She’s a responsible, hardworking woman who supports her family this way. She is requesting the loan to buy fruit like oranges at wholesale.  She is grateful for the loan granted and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The other group members sell grass, are cheese merchants, raise animals, have a printing shop and grocery store.

The members whose faces are obscured do not belong to this communal bank and the members in the inserted photos had asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of their work.

loans.use: to buy fruit like oranges at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: clean the land and prepare the soil to sow new plants.

loans.name: Joel  Mutie

texts.en:
Joel is 66 years old, married with five children. He earns a living as a poultry farmer. He has been in this business for two years. Besides this, he is a crop farmer for added income. 

He previously requested a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him improve his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Teresia  Nduta

texts.en:
Teresia is 45 years old and is married with two children who are in school. For the past 15 years, she has been a mixed farmer who runs a tea plantation and also is a dairy farmer. Teresia has three employees and also depends on her husband's salary. Since becoming a Faulu Kenya client, she has learned how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management.

Teresia is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer and animal feed. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Gabriel Mugii

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 24-year-old single man from Nyandarua South. For the past five years, he has been a tailor.

Gabriel is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy materials to use to make outfits for his clients. In the future, he hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy materials to make outfits

loans.name: Kancharisun Group

texts.es:
La socia Sofía tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera, ella es natural de la ciudad de Lima pero ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia Sofia es una joven emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los restos, ella es enfermera pero por el momento no está ejerciendo su profesión porque necesita especializarse, ella ahora esta estudiado otra carrera (Administración en Negocios Internacionales) y ya está en el quinto semestre. En esta oportunidad Sofía requiere el préstamo para uso personal desea pagar su mensualidad de la universidad. Su sueño de la socia Sofía es ser modelo profesional y terminar su carrera profesional de Administración. (La socia Sofía está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Kancharisun” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de materiales  de construcción, venta de ropa pero la mayoria son empleados que trabajan en entidades publicos y privadas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
