Sofía, 25, is single.  She’s originally from the city of Lima but now lives in the city of Cusco.  She’s an enterprising, responsible young woman who enjoys challenges.  She’s a nurse but for the moment isn’t working in her profession because she needs to specialize.  She’s now studying a second career (International Business Administration) and is in her fifth semester.  

On this occasion, Sofía needs the loan for personal use; she wants it to pay her monthly university tuition cost.  Her dream is to be an exemplary professional and to complete her Business Administration career.  (In the photo, Sofía is raising her hand).

This group is composed of neighbors and friends who formed the “Kancharisun” communal bank in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.  The communal bank is composed of people who are constantly seeking ways to get ahead with their daily effort and provide their children with better futures.  Some of their economic activities are: construction materials sales and clothing sales but most of them are employees in private and public firms.  The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province in Cusco Department.  It’s at the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas and is noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to pay monthly university tuition costs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells rice and tea leaves to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. With the additional income from her loan, she was able to support her family. 

Cecilia is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to buy more rice. She dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Julius  Mwangi

texts.en:
Julius is 68 years old, married with three children. He operates a butcher shop in a competitive business environment to earn a living. He has been in this business for twenty-five years and employs two people. Besides this, he plants tea to generate more income.

Through Faulu Kenya Julius has learnt how to save, because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location. Julius is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.name: Guillermo Eleazar

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo de 39 años de edad es separado de su familia. El tiene un negocio el cual el giro es un taller mecánico, tiene 12 años de experiencia en este ramo él se dedica 100% a su trabajo  es un ejemplo de superación y de salir adelante, sabe que aun que no  estén sus hijos con él, tiene que seguirles demostrando que con el trabajo duro se puede salir adelante. El está solicitando en esta ocasión de nuestra ayuda para la compra de maquinaria para su negocio ya que está en constante crecimiento.
texts.en: Guillermo, 39, is separated from his family.  He has an auto repair shop.  He has 12 years’ experience in this line of work.   He spends 100% of his time at work and he sets an example of self-improvement and getting ahead.  He knows that even though his children are no longer with him he still has to show them that one can get ahead by means of hard work.  He’s asking for a loan this time to buy machinery for his business since it’s constantly growing.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his auto shop.

loans.name: Dúo Vida Y Amor Group

texts.es: Dúo Vida y amor, este grupo está integrado  por la señora Sofía quien es originaria de San Juan Comalapa, es una persona muy emprendedora tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a la confección de tejidos típicos a mano ella trabaja solo con personas que le hacen pedidos ya que así no gasta mucho de su tiempo para entregar ya que siempre está ocupada con su actividad que realiza está solicitando este crédito para la  compra  de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos.
texts.en:
Life & Love Duo

Sofía is one of the members of this group.  She’s from San Juan Comalapa and is a very enterprising person.  She’s been working hand weaving traditional fabrics for several years.  Her work is all based on prior customer orders so that she doesn’t waste time at work; she’s always busy this way.  She’s asking for this loan to buy raw materials needed to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives in Armavir town. Since 2000, he has been a farmer who cultivates peach trees and keeps a grape orchard. Davit's work requires large expenses such as fertilizer and his current income is barely enough to cover this cost. 

Davit is requesting a loan to purchase stakes and wires to improve his grape orchard. He will also use his loan to purchase a calf since he plans to start breeding cattle. These changes will allow Davit to develop his farm and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy stakes, wires, and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to do the weeding in his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and cases of beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario no está casado pero vive con su pareja; ellos tienen cuatro hijos que son independientes. Mario vive con su pareja en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas y con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz.
Mario estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y con lo que gana de su trabajo como sastre debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de trabajo ya que desea comprar telas, forros e hilos al por mayor para la confección de trajes para posteriormente venderlos ya que trabaja por más de diez horas al día.
El sueño de Mario, es construir más habitaciones en su casa para poder acoger a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la décima vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mario isn’t married but lives with his spouse; they have four children who are all independent now.  Mario lives with his spouse in their own house occupying two small rooms with brick walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Juan zone.

Mario completed secondary school and knows that he must cover food and basic utility costs with money earned working as a tailor.

He needs the loan to buy materials and supplies for work; he wants to buy fabric, lining and thread at wholesale to make suits for subsequent sale.  He works more than ten hours per day.  

Mario’s dream is to add on more rooms to his house so that he can house his children and improve their quality of life.  This is his tenth loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli lives in Karakert village with her husband, father-in-law and 2 young sons.  Leyli works as a educator at the kindergarden of the nearest Shenik village. In addition, she is involved in agriculture together with her husband. They keep a cow, cultivate tomatoes, watermelons and grow apricot trees. 

Leyli has applied for this loan to purchase 2 pigs and grass to feed the cattle. Leyli hopes to get additional income from pig breeding, which is important for her to improve the conditions in the household and ensure a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: buy 2 pigs and cattle feed

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: Macario y su esposa María se dedican a producir café desde hace más de 30 años en las fincas que su padre le heredó. Con el paso del tiempo y a base de trabajar muy duro ellos han podido ir adquiriendo más terrenos para aumentar su patrimonio y poder producir más café. Durante la época de cosecha Macario contrata a sus tres hijos, quienes ya están casados, para que lo ayuden a trabajar en las fincas en las tareas de corte de café pues a él solo le sería imposible llevar a cabo toda esta actividad. Macario cuenta con un terreno el cual aún no está sembrado pues lo adquirió hace poco tiempo y quiere limpiarlo y comprar planta de café para que dentro de tres años le esté generando café y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos. Para poder llevar a cabo está actividad necesita un crédito el cual pagará al término de la siguiente cosecha de café y con lo que le quede de ganancia tiene planeado comprar una camioneta para poder transportar su café pues actualmente tiene que conseguir quien haga este trabajo. Entre las metas personales que Macario tiene están la de hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda y también la de apoyar a sus hijos a que pongan algún negocio para que puedan tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Macario and his wife María have been producing coffee for more than 30 years on the lands he inherited from his father. With the passing of time and working hard they’ve been able to acquire more land to increase their assets and yield more coffee. During the harvest, Macario hires his three children, who are all married, so they can help him in the field with cutting the coffee plants, something that would be impossible for him to do by himself. Macario has land that has not yet been sown because he acquired it just a short time ago. He would like to clear it and buy plants so that in three years it will generate coffee and that way his income will increase. To be able to do this, he is requesting a loan that he’ll pay back after his next coffee harvest, and with any money leftover, he plans to buy a truck so he can transport his own coffee and not have to hire someone to do it. Macario’s personal goals include renovating his house and supporting his children so that they can start their own businesses and generate better income.

loans.use: clear his land and buy coffee plants.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Zipporah, also a farmer. They are blessed with two children.  James has been in the farming business for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

James is applying for another loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.   With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana, es casada y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar; viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la localidad de Rió Abajo en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudió solo hasta terminar la primaria y actualmente se dedica  a la cria de  ganado y a la agricultura, sembrando hortalizas como lechuga, repollo y espinacas; también cuenta con una tienda de barrio, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad a sus clientes de la zona. De esta manera, Viviana trabaja por más de diez horas al día ya que ella y su esposo cubren los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada de lechuga, repollo y otras hortalizas  ya que desea mejorar su producción  y por consiguiente sus ingresos.
El sueño de Viviana es terminar de construir su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Viviana’s married and has three children who are attending school.  They live in her own two-bedroom house with adobe walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Río Abajo zone.

She only completed elementary school and currently works raising livestock and in agriculture.  She grows greens like lettuce, cabbage and spinach.  She also has a neighborhood store where she sells basic staples to local customers.  In this way, Viviana works more than ten hours daily since she and her husband must cover their family’s food, education and basic utility costs.

Viviana’s dream is to finish building her house to improve her quality of life.  This is her second loan request with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Esperanza De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos tiene su negocio de de moler maíz en su molino en Choluteca Honduras.
Doña Esperanza el préstamo lo invirtió en su negocio y con estos fondos a podido comprar otro molino y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejor precio. Gracias a este préstamo la ventas de su negocio han crecido considerablemente ya que sus clientes la prefieren, porque tiene mejores precios.
Doña Esperanza se dio cuenta del impacto que tuvo con la inversión y le gustaría seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos. Ya que le ha servido mucho para apalancar su negocio.
Doña Esperanza espera que en los próximos años poder crecer y poner otro negocio del mismo, y agenciarse de mejores utilidades para darle una mejor vida a su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Esperanza is 55 yearsold. She lives with her husband and children, and has a business grinding corn in her mill in Choluteca, Honduras.

Esperanza invested the loan in her business; and with these funds has been able to buy anther mill, and offer better service to her customers, as well as a better price.

Thanks to this loan, her business's sales have grown considerably, as her customers prefer her because she has better prices.

Esperanza realized the impact that the investment had, and would like to keep working with these types of loans. It has been very useful to her in leveraging her business.

Esperanza hopes to be able to grow in the coming years, set up another business doing the same thing, and get improved profits to give her family a better life.

Choluteca, Honduras - August, 2012

loans.use: To buy a mill for her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 42 years old and is from Nakuru.  He is married and has four children who are aged between 11 years and one year old.

Henry has a quarry business that he has been doing for the past five years.  He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy another quarry site for better income.   He hopes to own his lorry for a transport business.

loans.use: buy a quarry site

loans.name: Paul  Ngunze

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old, married and has three children who are in school. He operates a butcher shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for five years and has employed one person.  In addition, he practices livestock farming to generate more income. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Paul has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy 10 goats.

loans.use: buy 10 goats

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 49 years old, married and has five children who are aged between 12 years and four years old.

Paul is an artist and has been in it for the past 30 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy assorted paints for use in his business. The anticipated profit he will save and pay school fees for his children.   He hopes to become the leading artist in the region.

loans.use: buy  assorted paints

loans.name: Rahab  Nyokabi

texts.en:
Rahab is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has engaged in this business since the year 1996. She has employed one person to help her in her business. In additional, Rahab does dairy farming to supplement her income. 

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, Rahab has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and adding more chicks in the future. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: buy chicken feed

loans.name: Duncan Mwaura

texts.en:
Duncan is 34 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for three years.  In addition, he runs a motorcycle transport business and also does farming to supplement his income. 

Duncan had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to educate his children. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofé, tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en Rió Debajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la producción y comercialización de plantas trabajando por más de doce horas al día y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semillas para el cultivo de varios tipos de flores  para tener una mayor selección que ofrecer a sus clientes y  mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Cleofé es construir más habitaciones en su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Cleofé has three school age children.  She lives with her spouse and children in a house of her own occupying just one room with brick walls and dirt floor.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Río Debajo zone.

She currently grows plants to sell; she works more than 12 hours daily and uses what she earns to pay her family’s food, education and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to buy seeds to grow a variety of flowers to have a wider selection available for her customers and thus improve her income.  Cleofé’s dream is to add more rooms to her house to provide more comfort for her family and improve their quality of life.

This is her second loan request with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds.

loans.name: Japhet  Ganira

texts.en: Japhet is 39 years old, married and has two children who are in school. He runs a taxi transport business to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for twenty years.  In addition, he operates a retail shop and also does livestock farming to generate more income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his savings well because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of owning a car for his transport business in the future. Japhet has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour and rice for his retail shop.

loans.use: buy sugar, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: David  Njoroge

texts.en:
David is 37 years old, married and has three children who are in school. He operates a grocery store in a competitive environment to earn a living. He has been in the business for fifteen years. In addition, he does dairy farming to generate more income. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, David has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of owning more dairy cows in the future. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 32 years old and is from Ndunyu Njeru,  She is married and has four children who are aged between 14 years and 1 year old.

Rosemary is a farmer and has been in it for the past 13 years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy seeds and chemicals and pay for labor.  She hopes to expand her farming business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy seeds, chemicals and pay for labor

loans.name: Alice   Njoki

texts.en:
Alice is a hardworking business lady and a mother of four children. She operates a butcher shop for a living. She has engaged in this business for twelve years and has employed three people.  In addition, she sells cereals and does farming to supplement her income. 

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, Alice has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of operating another butcher shop in a different location in the future. She has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES to add stocks of maize, beans and rice to her cereal shop.

loans.use: buy maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old.  He is married to Rachael and together they have three children.  He works in a quarry and has been in the business for the past 20 years.

This is Peter's fourth term loan with KADET LTD.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  Peter will use this loan amount to pay school fees for his children.  He hopes to diversify and become a dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: pay school fees

loans.name: Simon  Karanja

texts.en:
Simon is 42 years old, married and has two children who are in school. He sells vegetables like cabbages and kales in a dynamic environment. In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. He has engaged in this business for four years. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Simon has learned how to keep his business records because he has been trained on business management. He dreams of becoming a large scale farmer in the future. Simon has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: buy cabbages and tomatoes

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town in the southern area of Bo. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 12 years and 32 years. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is a retired worker.  She started this business to raise a permanent source of income to support her family. 

Hawa runs a food stand business at the market.  She sells palm oil, pepper, and Maggie (soy sauce). She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business from 7:00AM until 7:30PM, 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from her two senior children. Hawa says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to in to buy more palm oil, rice, salt, onions and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a general store. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: buy palm oil, rice, salt, onions and pepper

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 kg of sugar, 50 kg of rice, and 20 liters of oil to sell in his store.

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad I Group

texts.es:
La socia Janeth 31 años de edad y  tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco pero ahora vive en la ciudad del Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco. La socia Janeth es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los restos, ella es enfermera y trabaja una posta de salud de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Janeth requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.  El sueño de la socia Janeth es que su hijo se ha profesional. (La socia Janeth está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Virgen de Natividad I” en la provincia del Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos y chanchos, venta de chicha de jora, venta de plásticos, venta de pasto y el socio varón brinda servicio de construcción. (El socio varón no está presente en la reunión por motivos de trabajo pero su esposo la representa en el banco comunal).

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Janeth, 31, lives in common-law marriage from which she has a son. She was born in the city of Cusco but now lives in Huayllabamba in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. Janeth is an enterprising and responsible mother who is well-liked. She is a nurse and works at a clinic in Ollantaytambo. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chikens, a business she has had for three years and which is going well. At this time, Janeth needs a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Janeth's dream is that her son follows a professional career. (She is the woman holding up her hand in the photo.)

The members of this communal bank “Virgen de Natividad I” are neighbors and friends from Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. They are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and work hard every day to provide a brighter future for their children. The members' businesses include raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks; selling maize beer; selling plastics; selling pasta; and the man works in construction. (The male member did not attend the meeting because he had to work, but his wife is representing him in the photo.) The members are grateful for the opportunity offered and promise to make their payments on time.

The city of Cusco is located in the province and department of Cusco. It is the ancient city of the Incas and is a tourist area known for its archeological centers, its historic district, its landscape and history, and for being a charming city in the southern part of the country. Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is here.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ollantay Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de papa, la socia vende en los diferentes mercados y también vende a los restaurants, la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va bien también la socia vende papa peladas que le piden por contrata ella vende al por mayor, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas y compartir con sus hijos, la socia es una persona empeñosa y muy trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa al por mayor.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurant, negocio de servicio de taxi y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "OLLANTAY II"; This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

This member is Gregoria. She lives with her partner, is 38 years old and has three children. She likes to work in her potato selling business and she sells in various markets as well as to restaurants. The member has worked in this activity for five years and it is going well. She also sells peeled potatoes by previous order, which she sells wholesale. In her free time she likes to prepare tortas to share with her children. The member is an earnest, hard working person. Her dream is to have a place from where she could sells her potatoes. The member is requesting a loan to buy potatoes wholesale.

The other members make a living in various activities; restaurants, general store, taxi service and selling food.

The member is grateful to those who have formed a part of helping her accomplish her dream and she is committed to making her payments within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: to buy potato wholesale.

loans.name: Linus Alphonse

texts.fr: Alphonse est un homme âgé de 37 ans,marié et père de 04 enfants dont l' âge varie entre 05 et 15 ans.Trois de ses enfants sont scolarisés.Il est a ouvert et gère un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 02 ans déjà.sa gentillesse, son acceuil chaleureux et ses bonnes relations lui ont valu une grande clientèle qu'il a du mal à satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanente des stocks.Il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et ses revenus afin de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle.Les bénéfices issus de ce crédit lui premettront de reinvestir,divertifier son activité et assurer la scolarité de ses enfant.
texts.en:
Alphonse is a 37 year old man, married and father to 4 children whose age varies between 5 and 15 years. Three of his children go to school. He opened and has been managing a bar in a neighborhood of the capital for 2 years already. His kindness, his warm welcome and his good relationships have brought him a large clientèle which he has trouble satisfying because of the permanent stock shortages.

He is requesting a loan to increase his stock of merchandise and his revenue in order to satisfy his numerous clientèle. The profits resulting from this loan will allow him to reinvest, diversify his business and ensure his children are able to go to school.

loans.use: to buy approximately 30 cases of drinks.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 61 years old, from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married, with four adult children. Margarita's husband works as a farmer. 

Together with her husband, they grow rice, which is a staple food for every Filipino. This business has been their source of income for a long time now. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, healthy seedlings and to pay for labor. 

In the future, Margarita hopes to farm a larger area, so she can have a better chance of a good profit. She also hopes to retire in comfort with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, healthy seedlings and to pay for labor

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es:
Don Prudencio tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y  tres hijos. Él estaba casado; pero tubo problemas con su esposa, por lo que se separo de ella y se volvió a acompañar con otra señora y los tres hijos que procreo con la primera. Es agricultor desde su juventud, aprendió el trabajo junto con su padre. Él dice que se siente alegre con el trabajo que desempeña. 

Compra los insumos agrícolas en la ciudad más cercana que esta a ocho kilómetros de distancia, camina treinta minutos para llegar al punto de vehículos y autobuses, aborda uno de ellos que tarda unos quince minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra todo lo que necesita; después de adquirir todo lo que necesita tiene que cargarlos él mismo hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pago de mano de obra para cortar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, pagar el alquiler de una maquina para moler zacate y hacer el ensilaje para alimentar dos vacas y limpiar el terreno para sembrar fríjol. Con la inversión, manifiesta don Prudencio que se evitara comprar concentrado para sus vacas en época seca, sembrara más cantidad de producto, debido a que con sus propios recursos no lo podría hacer. Con la producción de maíz que es la más próxima a recibir, podrá asegurar la alimentación de su familia y comercializara una parte recibiendo ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Prudencio is 51 years old. He lives with his partner and his three children. He was married but had problems with his wife, so they separated and he started to live with his current partner and his three children from his previous marriage. He has been a farmer since his youth, as he learnt the work with his father. He says that he is happy with the work he carries out.

He buys his agricultural supplies in the closest city which is eight kilometres away. He walks 30 minutes to get to where there are vehicles and buses. He takes one which takes about 15 minutes to arrive to where he buys everything he needs. Then, once he has acquired everything, he has to carry it all himself to his house.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay hired labour to cut 7,000 square metres of corn, to pay for the hire of a machine to grind hay and to make the silage to feed two cows, and to clear the terrain on order to sow beans. With this investment Prudencio states he will avoid having to buy feed for his cows in the dry season, he will sow greater quantities of product, he will be able to feed his family and he will sell a part in order to receive income for the household.

loans.use: to pay hired labour to cut 7,000 square metres of corn, to pay for the hire of a machine to grind hay and to make the silage to feed two cows, and to clear the terrain on order to sow beans.

loans.name: Peter  Munga

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking businessman, married, with three children who are in school. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has engaged in this business since 1996 and has employed one person. In addition, he generates extra income from his rental houses. 

Peter previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Dorine  Akinyi

texts.en: Dorine is 39 years old and a single mother of two. She sells clothes in a busy environment to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for five years and has employed one person. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management. She dreams of operating more outlets in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a 51-year-old father of 10 children from Bien Unido, Bohol. He considers his children a blessing and works hard for them. Four of them are still dependents, ranging from ages 11 to 17. 

Nilo relies on his livelihood farming seaweed, locally known as "guso." His wife also helps him. He has done this type of work for 15 years now. He is asking for a loan to buy straw, gasoline, and wooden stakes and to pay for boat maintenance. 

Nilo hopes that, in the future, he can improve and expand his business to earn a better income to provide for his family, especially a healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy straw, gasoline, and wooden stakes and to pay for boat maintenance

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
Felisa, es casada y no tiene hijos vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, La casa se encuentra ubicada en Rió Abajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la producción de leche y a la agricultura trabajando por más de diez horas  al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ya que su esposo es comerciante, viaja mucho y le envía poco dinero cada fin de mes.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar su producción de leche y por ende  sus ingresos.
El sueño de Felisa, es construir su casa y aumentar su ganado para tener más ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
Anteriormente se dedicaba más a la venta de comida, pero ahora prefiere dedicarse a esta nueva actividad.
texts.en:
Felisa’s married and has no children.  She lives in her own house occupying a room with brick walls and dirt floor.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Río Abajo zone.  She currently earns income selling milk and working in agriculture.  She covers her family’s basic utility payments and food costs because her husband is a merchant and travels constantly and but only sends her a little money at the end of each month.

She needs the loan to buy a dairy cow because she wants to increase milk production and as a result, increase income too.  Felisa’s dream is to build her house and increase her herd size.  This is her second IMPORT loan request and second with KIVA.  She used to work selling food  but now prefers doing her new activity.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dye and fabric.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, tiene un hijo y se separo hace más de un año de su esposa; Julio vive con su hijo  en casa propia ocupando una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en el Palomar en el Departamento de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la producción y cultivo de flores trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semillas de diferentes flores por cantidad ya que desea mejorar sus cultivos, ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes  y aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Julio es construir un par de habitaciones más en su casa para dar más comodidad a su hijo ya que entrara a la universidad.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio has a son; he separated from his wife over a year ago.  Julio lives with his son in his own house occupying a single room with adobe walls and dirt floor.  The house is located in El Palomar in La Paz Department.

He currently works growing flowers more than ten hours daily since he must cover his family’s education, food and basic utility costs with what he earns.  He needs the loan to buy various flower seeds to offer more variety to his customers and increase his income this way.

Julio’s dream is to build a couple of rooms at home to provide his son more comfort since he will soon start university.  This is his second IMPRO loan request and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old, from Ndunyu Njeru, married, and has three children between 14 years and nine years old.

Rose is a farmer and has been doing this for the past seven years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully completing the previous one, to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be able to buy another piece of land that she will use for farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Joseph Wathome

texts.en: Joseph is 62 years old and married with three children. He does farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for two years. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of increasing the size of his farm in the future. He has requested for a loan of 25,000 KES to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal HAPPY AYLLU; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa Hilda, la socia tiene 60 años de edad, viuda y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, champús, perfumes entre otros, la socia vende de forma independiente a sus clientes que más le solicitan como amistades y familiares, la socia a la vez vende productos naturales que también lo vende de forma independiente, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio el cual mediante este la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como colonias.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de chompas, venta de productos de belleza, compra y venta de productos de limpieza, profesor censante, docente, adminstrador independiente.

La socia que sale adjunta en la foto es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank HAPPY AYLLU; This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Rosa Hilda. She is 60 years old, a widow and has three children. The member combines her daily activities with the business of selling beauty products, such as creams, colognes, shampoos, perfumes, among other things. The member sells independently to her customers and has carried out this activity for years. It is going well thanks to the effort she makes and this enables her to get ahead.

The member requests this loan in order to buy stock such as cologne.

The other members make a living selling jumpers, beauty products, buying and selling cleaning products, teaching, and an independent administrator.

The member who has been added to the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

The member feels grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making all her established payments.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as colognes, to sell.

loans.name: Juntos Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia Vilma tiene 39 años de edad y  es madre y padre para sus dos hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad de  Quillabamba pero desde hace 9 años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco. La socia Vilma es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los retos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y artefactos, ella viaja cada fin de semana uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Limatambo a vender sus productos. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y artefactos. El sueño de la socia Vilma es que sus hijos se han profesionales. (La socia Vilma está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Juntos para el Progreso” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de caramelos,  venta de comida, venta de Cd y venta de ropa.  (La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presente en la reunión).

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Vilma, 39, is both mother and father for her two children.  She’s originally from the city of Quillabamba but has lived in the city of Cusco in Cusco Province and Cusco Department for the last nine years.  She’s an enterprising, responsible mother who liked challenges.  She sells clothes and appliances.  She travels weekly to one of the markets in the city of Limatambo to sell her wares.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion, Vilma needs the loan to buy clothes and appliances.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.  (Vilma is raising her hand in the photo).

This group is composed of friends and neighbors who formed the “Juntos para el Progerso” (Together for Progress) communal bank in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.  This communal bank’s members are all people who are always seeking ways to get ahead and with their daily effort provide their children with a better future.  Their economic activities are varied.  Among them are: candy sales, food sales, CD sales and clothing sales.  (The member who appears in the bottom of the photo requested permission from the governing board to miss the meeting).  The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District, Province and Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also noted for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy clothes and appliances.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi lives in Karakert village with her parents, two sisters and brother. Armenuhi and her family members are involved in cattle breeding. They raise cows and pigs, and grow grass, which is used as forage for the cattle. Unfortunately, the grass they grow is not enough to feed all their cattle during winter so Armenuhi has applied for this loan to purchase more grass. This will allow her to keep developing the farm and earn a stable income.

loans.use: to pay for grass to feed the cattle

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Help Accion fund a rain shield gutter entrepreneur in Miami Florida!  After immigrating to the United States from Colombia, Mario transitioned from job to job in the construction industry, until establishing his own company in 2007.   While on the job working for others, he realized the frequency that gutters and shutters had to be replaced due to the inclement weather conditions in South Florida.   This realization would guarantee any quality business in this arena a steady clientele. With the creation of Rain Shield Gutters, a company that specializes in the installation of gutters and shutters for private and commercial properties, Mario not only found a niche but also accomplished a dream.  

Mario wakes up every day with a smile on his face because he feels that his work is meaningful to communities in South Florida. As he states, “I am proud to say that my business does not only help provide for my wife and son, but it also creates three jobs that are an important support to my employees’ families”. Most importantly, Mario puts his heart in every single job.

Mario has seen a significant growth in demand for his services in the past year. A loan from ACCION will help Mario to purchase another vehicle, which will allow him to mobilize his workers to more sites, which in turn means that the business can take on a greater number of jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Gs Sor Dionicia Group

texts.es:
La señora Cruz de 44 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus dos nietos y su hijo menor quien le ayuda en su negocio, no tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de pulpería donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es la líder del grupo ya que es la persona quien se ha dedicado  ha  mantener el grupo en buen funcionamiento.
Doña Cruz esta solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de frescos, churros, pastas, verduras, lácteos, pollo, pan, café, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, manteca, embutidos y carnes.
Doña Cruz con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y seguir adelante con su proyecto que es de hacer mas grande la pulpería y comprarse un terreno para construir su propia casa. Ella esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA siempre y cuando se le apoye, y con las ganancias generadas por el negocio quiere comprarse el solar para hacer su casa.
Doña Cruz su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio y también hacer realidad su sueño que es hacer su propia casa.
Alcida y Yenifer se dedican a tiempo completo a sus negocios ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Cruz, 44, is single and lives with her two grandchildren and her youngest son who helps her with the store.  She does not own a house and has worked as a grocer for several years; she sells basic staple items.  She is the group leader since she’s the person who has kept the group working together.

Cruz is asking for a 5000 Lempira loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks, noodles, vegetables, dairy products, chicken, bread, coffee, sugar, beans, rice, lard, canned goods and meats.  With support from this loan, Cruz intends to meet the need her business has for financing and continue forward with her project which is to enlarge the grocery store and buy a piece of property to build her house on.  She’s very happy to continue working with PRISMA as long as it continues supporting her and to use profits earned by the store to buy a lot to build her house.  Cruz’s dream is to stay in business and improve the store as well as to make her dream of owning a house a reality.

Alcida and Yenifer work full-time in their businesses since they are their main source of income.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 38-year-old father of three children and married to Milka, is a farmer in Olkalau town. He has been in the farming business for the past two years.

This is Joseph's first loan, and he plans to buy farm inputs, which include fertilizer and pesticides. He also plans to buy a sheep. With the anticipated income, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his farming methods and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, including fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri began her career in the beauty industry at 16 years old as a hairstylist assistant in the Bronx and in Harlem, NY. While providing hair care, extensions and styling to women for so many years, she often found herself having to mix several products together in order to get the results she wanted for her clients; mostly women of color. In 2006, she began a creative quest of research; trial and testing in order finalize a product that could help women of color hair types. In 2009, she started Tress Labs Inc. in order to formalize her freelance hair styling as well as to be able to trademark Formula N Hair Care, a line of natural and organic topical hair treatments intended to strengthen, build elasticity and hydrate brittle, chemically processed and natural hair types. The very first hair treatments were released this spring including Formula N Drop N's and Formula N Oil Steam Treatment. See http://formulanhaircare.com/

All other products are still in development but for now, she needs a loan from Accion to fund the completion of her website and to help her fulfill her first large order from Ana Hair Design Studio located in Upper Manhattan. She has received much interest from other stylists and would put part of the funds towards marketing and packaging. In addition to the freelance styling she does for private clients, she also is a stylist for BET, Black Entertainment Productions. Njeri is well connected in the world of black women's beauty and has the potential to take her business to the next level. Please help Njeri get her products off the ground and help her to market them on her website.  Njeri has big dreams. Help them become a reality.

loans.use: to market her website and pay for inventory

loans.name: Rozalia

texts.en: Rozalia trades in women's clothing. She rents a booth in a city market, where she operates her business. Rozalia started this business in 2009. She has applied for this loan to purchase clothing for the coming autumn-winter season. This is important for Rozalia to keep her current level of sales and save for further development of her business.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell

loans.name: Pemuco Crece Contigo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Pemuco crece contigo” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de frutas y verduras, venta de ensaladas surtidas, venta de ropa, pastelería, tejido, peluquería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Maria integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color verde, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa en lencería, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa 3 a 4 veces a la semana, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad y a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará lencería para damas, diferentes tallas y modelos.
Una de las metas de Maria es surgir y crecer con su negocio y tener la posibilidad de agregar un espacio en su casa para colocar su negocio para poder atender a su clientela de manera cómoda.
Maria vive sola por el momento. Sus sueños a nivel laboral  son crecer y vender mucho mas y captar más clientela, a nivel personal terminar un tratamiento para adelgazar y poder tener un hijo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Pemuco Crece Contigo” (Pemuco Grows with You) and it has 19 members who carry out various lines of work.  Among them are: fruit and vegetable sales, assorted salad sales, clothing sales, pastry sales, weaving, barber shop and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Chillán.

María is a communal bank member and in the photo appears standing in the front row, fourth from right to left, wearing a green jacket; her hair is dark brown and she wears it loose.

She has been selling lingerie for the last three years.  She comments that she works at home three or four times per week and sets her schedule according to her availability.  She buys merchandise as needed in Santiago because of the wider variety available and the low prices which is economically advantageous for her.  She will use the loan to buy various styles and sizes of women’s lingerie.

One of María’s goals is to surge forward and to grow with her business and perhaps be able to add a locale at home to set up her store so that she can tend to customers more comfortably.  María lives alone at present.  Her dream for work is to grow and to sell much more and capture a larger clientele; on the personal level she hopes to complete a weight reduction program and to be able to have a child.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her because it’s made it possible for her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank because they share different activities and interests which has served as a moment of enjoyment for her.  With respect to the training provided, she’s learned how to manage her business better.

Chillán is a commune in south Chile.  Its name means “Chair of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people.  Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Fatherland” or “Land of Artists” because distinguished personages in Chilean history, like the famous pianist Claudio Arrau, were born here.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie

loans.name: Yolofo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 23 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé  le 15 novembre 2006. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Yolofo (assis sur la chaise à l’extrême droite dans la photo) est emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfant (02 garçon et 01 fille).
Elle achète et revend du poisson fumé,  une activité qu’elle fait depuis plus de 4 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre en détaille dans son village et les villages environnants.
-	Pour une somme de 65 000F Cfa de marchandise (poisson fumé) il lui faudra 02 semaines en moyenne pour l’écouler.
Elle se retrouve souvent avec un bénéfice net de 10 000F Cfa après déduction de toutes ses charges.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This is a group of 23 women who are very active members of the local Banc Villageois created on November 15, 2006. They are all from the same village and get along nicely. Their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Yolofo (sitting at the far right in the photo) is the featured borrower for the group. She is a 50-year-old married mother of three children, two boys and a girl. She has been buying and selling smoked fish for over four years.  

She will use this loan to stock up on smoked fish at the weekly markets and sell the merchandise at retail in her village and surrounding areas. 

On average, it takes her two weeks to sell 65,000F Cfa worth of smoked fish. She often ends up with a net profit of 10,000F Cfa after subtracting all her expenses.

The profits earned through this activity will allow her to take over part of the daily expenses as well as her children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is a resident of Kandal Stoeng district located in Kandal province, Cambodia. She is 53 years old and has six children, one of whom is a student and the rest have their own employment to make their living. Yorn is a widowed mother who works as a farmer. Yorn has been growing rice to support her family for about 40 years. 

Yorn, after completely paying back her first loan to VisionFund, is now leading her current group of two to apply for another loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to purchase fertilizers for the rice crops and pay for farmland preparation. Yorn hopes that this loan will enable her to grow more rice of a better quality so that she can sell the crops for a better price to enable her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a livestock farmer in Olkalau town. He does a livestock buying and selling business and it has been profitable. He is married to Miriam and has six children.

This will be his fifth loan amount and he plans to buy calves and sheep for rearing and later sell them. He anticipates making more income, with which he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Benson hopes to invest more in his business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Maritza y su esposo Cesar son padres de familia y tiene dos hijas de edad escolar a quienes les quieren dar la educación.
Solicitan el préstamo para poder pagar los gastos escolares que son la compra de uniformes, útiles y el pago de la inscripción.
La señora Maritza se dedica desde hace aproximadamente un año a la venta de ropa enfrente de su vivienda y así atender a su familia, su esposo el señor Cesar trabaja desde hace dos años en una tienda comercial como vendedor de muebles. Con las ganancias del negocio pagaran el crédito y que con el sueldo que recibe el señor Cesar será para los gastos familiares que se presenten.
texts.en: Maritza and her husband Cesar are the parents of two school-aged daughters whom they want to educate. They are applying for the loan to be able to pay for school expenses: the registration fee and the purchase of uniforms and supplies. Maritza has been working for about a year selling clothing in front of her house and helping her family that way. For the past two years, Cesar has worked in a store as a furniture seller. They will pay off the loan with the income from the business, and Cesar's salary will be for any household expenses.

loans.use: to pay school-related expenses.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old from Nakuru and is married with seven children who are aged between 10 years and one year old.

Nancy is a farmer and has been in it for the past five years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use in her farm for a better harvest.

She hopes to see her business expand and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She started a sari-sari store business five years ago as her source of income. Rosalinda sells basic household commodities like toiletries, detergents, seasoning, canned goods, and chips. She also manages a rice farm for additional profit. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and also merchandise like canned goods, noodles, eggs, and seasoning. The loan will greatly help her in making the most out of her business. 

In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger so she can attract more customers and increase her income. She will spend her profit on a healthy diet and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and also merchandise like canned goods, noodles, eggs, and seasoning.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 48 years old. He is married to Milkah and together they have three children. He operates a general shop and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He hopes to purchase more stock of rice, sugar, flour, and soaps for his shop.

He hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, sugar, flour, and soaps.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie runs a food stand business within a busy market area; she sells vegetable oil, onions, tomatoes, pasta, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business every day, seven days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. At present her business is doing well. She has more sales on occasion.  

Kadie has requested a loan in order to buy more vegetable oil, onions, tomatoes, pasta, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her business. 

In the future, she plans to send her children to university and build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more vegetable oil, onions, tomatoes, pasta, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Elmer Bladimir

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Él se dedica al oficio de estructuras metálicas desde hace seis años, aprendió gracias a que trabajaba como ayudante en un taller cercano. Antes realizaba la actividad de ayudante de albañilería y agricultor. Él realiza los trabajos en el taller, para instalar las estructuras tiene que desplazarse al domicilio de sus clientes; a veces debe recorrer largas distancias hasta dos horas de camino para entregar los productos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una pulidora industrial, un taladro y el resto para comprar implementos tales como extensiones eléctricas. Con la inversión, Elmer podrá realizar los trabajos de forma personalizada y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Su sueño es contar con un taller bien establecido, que le genere ingresos suficientes para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 21 years old. He lives with his life companion and their two children. For six years he has followed the trade of metal-working. He learned it thanks to the fact that he worked as a helper in a nearby workshop. 

Previously, he was a bricklayer's helper and farmer. He does jobs in his workshop, and to install the metal structures he has to go to his customers' homes. Sometimes he must travel long distances up to two hours away, in order to deliver his products. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy an industrial polisher, a drill, and the rest to buy items such as extension cords.

With the investment, Elmer will be able to carry out his jobs in a personalized way and improve his income. His dream is to have a well-established workshop that will generate sufficient income to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy an industrial polisher, a drill and the rest to buy items such extension cords.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad que se encuentra valdia  e  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar  este almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leandro is 57 years old, is married, and currently lives with his wife.  With this loan he intends to buy coffee seedlings in order to later plant them in a small property that is good and other items such as fertilizers and pesticides as well as to hire day laborers.

He has thought about buying these seedlings in order to produce a little more and be able to generate more income and obtain a better quality of life and more economic stability.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 37 years old. She is married to Perminus and together they have three children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase more inventory of clothes for use in her business.

She hopes to start farming so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe ya ha tenido crédito en KIVA el cual ha pagado puntual mente y ha sido para invertir en su negocio.
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación en este préstamo, que es para invertir en mercancía, ya que se le termino todo lo que tenia y quiere comprar mercancía de temporada de invierno para estar preparado cuando sus clientes le solicite este tipo de prenda ella va a tener en su negocio lo que necesitan.
La señora María Guadalupe  con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito y que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad.
Desea que su negocio tenga mas variedad de mercancía y más ingreso y con esta inversión lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe has already taken a loan from Kiva which was invested in her business and repaid on time.

She is once again requesting your cooperation with this loan, which she will use to invest in merchandise, since she has sold out of everything she had. She wants to buy merchandise for the winter season so that she'll be prepared when her customers come looking for these types of garments.  This way, she will have the items that they need.

With the profits she gets from her business Maria Guadalupe will pay off the loan, because her husband takes care of the household bills and school fees with his earnings from his job as a security guard.

Maria wants her business to have a greater variety of merchandise and to generate more income, and she will achieve these results with this investment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Simon  Mwendwa

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking 32-year-old businessman who operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for three years. He describes his immediate business environment as busy with reliable customers. He also does farming to supplement his income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills that he uses in his retail shop. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 44 and the father of four children,  is a farmer. He is married to Rahab and they live in Olkalau town. He plants cash crops such as maize, beans, carrots and potatoes. He also raises livestock.

This will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy fertilizer and manure to use on his farm. He also plans to buy animal feed. He anticipates making more profits with which he'll pay school fees for his children.

Joseph hopes to improve his farming methods, make more income and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has five children and they are still in school. She has been in the farming business together with her husband for several years now. They grow rice, corn, and other food crops in their field. Moreover, she is also engaged in woodworking business and carpentry. This provides them the income that they need for their daily sustenance. 

As of now, Constancia is in need of additional capital for their business. She is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the plants and to pay the school fees of her children. With this, she and her husband will be able to grow and produce healthy crops which are good to market.

In the future, Constancia hopes to improve their lives. In addition to this, it is her greatest desire to send her children to school and allow them to reach their dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plants and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 56 years old and married to Elizabeth. He is a butcher in Nyahururu town and his business has been profitable.

This is his second loan and he plans to buy goats for slaughter and stock up his business. He will use the generated income to expand his business.

He hopes to open another business, such as wholesaling, and make more income.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en:
Sarrah, 32, is from Kandeh town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, 15 and 6. Her children are currently attending school. In 1995, Sarrah established a food stand business at her house. She began her business because she did not go to school. Her parent taught her business at the age of 16 and she was sent to be married. She works at the business every day, including holidays. She says her major problem is lack of capital to buy more stock to improve her business.

Sarrah requires a loan in order to buy more rice, Maggi (flavor enhancer), palm oil, and onions. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Sarrah plans to build a cement house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, Maggi, palm oil, and onions

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of fine silver to continue production.

Adriana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Born in Italy, Adriana has lived in Peru most of her life. "I began designing and crafting jewelry as a hobby, something to do in my free time when not looking after my daughters. But it snowballed and today I dedicate all my time to this craft."

"Thank you very much for this microcredit. As always, you can be certain the jewelry I craft is done with the utmost dedication to quality and, most especially, that it is crafted with loving care. Many thanks, and may God bless you."

Use the link below to view Adriana's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5991

loans.use: to purchase fine silver in bulk.

loans.name: Jessica Esmeralda

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a vender frutas por las tardes en su comunidad y cosméticos, viaja cada dos días al mercado de una ciudad a comprar las frutas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más frutas y cosméticos, debido a que actualmente no trabaja con capital propio. De esta manera, tendrá disponible suficiente fruta y cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes y recibir mejores ingresos; que le permitan instalar la luz eléctrica en su casa y que sus hijos estudien, su hijo mayor este año se gradúa del kinder y la más pequeña tiene un mes de nacida.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 22, lives with her life partner and their two children.  She sells fruit and cosmetics in the afternoons in her community.  Every two days she travels to a city market to buy the fruit.

The loan she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy more fruit and cosmetics.  This is because she currently is not working with her own capital.  This way she will have enough fruit and cosmetics available to offer her customers and to get better income.

This will allow her to install electricity in her house so her children will be able to study.  Her oldest child graduated from kindergarten this year, and the littlest one is one month old.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gs La Coyotera Group

texts.es:
El señor Pedro de 40 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos, vive en su propia casa y se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de frutas  y abarrotería, vive con su conyugue quien le atiende uno de los puesto de venta de frutas, agua y elotes, el actualmente es el líder del grupo solidario la coyotera ubicado en la zona del turismo Jicaro Galán al sur de Honduras, don Pedro sobresale por ser una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante es un comerciante de futuro y emprendedor.
Don Pedro esta solicitando 13,000.00 lempiras para compra de frutas como Melones, Sandias, papayas, Bananos, Naranjas, Mangos y abarrotaría como ser detergentes, elotes, cloros, granos básicos, embutidos y otros productos.
Don Pedro con el apoyo de este préstamo el  pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita para su negocio al igual que sus compañeras de grupo.
Don Pedro su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener mas puestos donde vender sus frutas y sus productos.
Al igual que sus compañeros que se dedican a la venta de ropa dos de ellas, la señora CRISTY Y DOÑA INGRIS. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old, and has three children. He lives in his own house with his family, and makes a living selling fruits, vegetables and general store items. His wife also helps him run the store. Pedro is the leader of a solidarity group called, "La Coyotera," which is located in the tourist zone of "Jicaro Galán," in the south of Honduras. Pedro is known for being a hardworking person who always seeks to excel and get ahead as an entrepreneur and businessman of the future.

Pedro is requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 lempiras, and he plans to use this support to purchase fruit, such as: cantaloupe, watermelon, papayas, bananas, oranges, mangoes, as well as general store items, including detergent, bleach, corn and other staple food grains, sausage, and other products. He hopes that this investment and loan will help strengthen his business, as well as the businesses of his fellow group members.

Some day, Pedro dreams of improving his house and opening up additional locations for selling his produce and products. His fellow group members, Cristy and Ingris, make a living selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, cantaloupe, papayas, bananas, oranges, mangoes and miscellaneous items including detergent, bleach, corn and other staple food grains, sausages, etc for his business.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Pablo es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposa la que lo apoya en todo las tareas que el realiza. El y su familia Viven en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. El se dedica a su negocio propio de compra y venta de ganado.
